item.title: Fall 09 Market Overview
item.description: After a long summer off, AJ Monte and Rick Swope resume The Market Guys' podcast with a look at the markets going into the fall. They analyze the DIA, GLD and wrap up with a look at the USD compared to the Canada and Euro currency. Now is a good time to refresh the basics with The Market Guys!

item.title: Positioning for a Falling Dollar
item.description: Rick Swope and AJ Monte respond to an article in the UK Telegraph, "A Copper Standard for the world's currency system?" The article claims that "Beijing is trying to extricate itself from dollar dependency as fast as it can." If that is true, how can you profit from metals and other dollar hedges? Join The Market Guys as they introduce the power of ETFs and options.

item.title: How Low will it Go?
item.description: Fear is gripping the news reports as people wonder how low the market will drop. The real question is how are you managing your investments and trading now? Whether the Dow hits 4000 this year or returns to 14,000, you need to protect yourself and follow the money. AJ Monte and Rick Swope discuss these and other current events in today's program.

item.title: How to Ride the Financial Shockwaves
item.description: AJ Monte and Rick Swope hit current events with a discussion of the financial crisis in our economy. With the fall of industry giants like Bear Stearns, Lehman and Merrill, what can an investor do to avoid getting crushed? Part of the answer is learning the language of technical analysis - people may lie, but the charts are very reliable.

item.title: Rapid Fire Stock Analysis with The Market Guys.
item.description: AJ Monte and Rick Swope bring back their most popular segment called Rapid Fire Stock Analysis. This is where they take five stocks (DIA, QQQQ, SPY, TRA and POT) and go through the charts to identify buy signals while establishing key exit points to reduce risk. This segment is intentionally dated so you can go back to the day they were looking at the charts and follow along to track their accuracy. We are sure you will enjoy this show.

item.title: Rapid Fire Stock Analysis
item.description:
Rick and AJ discuss 5 stocks using their rapid fire method which helps you learn how to identify entry points and target areas. This session will also help you identify the support levels to help you set your stops to minimize risk.
Newmont Mining Ticker: NEM Bias to the upside Target area is the Gap area from first week in September which is around $50- 51.50. Stop area with close below 44.66
Hewlett Packard Ticker: HPQ Bias to the upside Target over highs at $40 Exit below support around 38 near the 50 day moving average
Diamonds Trust Ticker: DIA Bias to the Downside Target for the DOW is 300-400 points lower This would result in a 3-4 point drop in the Diamonds to 118 Exit short positions should DIA close above the most recent highs around 122
CSX Corp Ticker: CSX Bias to the Downside Target area 34 which is the support area seen at the November 1st lows.
Waste Management Ticker: WMI Bias to the Downside Target area $36.50-37 Exit on a close above the November 9th highs

item.title: Testing the stock selection skills
item.description:
Please note that this Podcast was recorded on May 11th
The point of this broadcast is to display the accuracy in the stock selection skills of The Market Guys.
Rick & AJ have put themselves on the line by forecasting price targets for the short term outlook on 4 stocks and have recorded these picks for the world to see. Keep in mind that they are clear in their risk management strategies by outlining the stop levels that would limit losses to small amounts had the stocks moved against them. We hope you enjoy the show as you follow along with the following stock picks:
Cigna Corp. (Ticker: CI)
Strategy: Buy Long
Price target is last gap left on May 3rd (101-102)
Support 88.09 stop loss set below 88
Target Corp. (Ticker: TGT)
Strategy: Sell Short
Failing the 200 day moving average
Short term Price target was 50-51
Buy stop set above 55.50
Cytec Industries (Ticker: CYT)
Note that AJ mentioned the long position would only be taken if the stock closes with a positive candle pattern the days after the Doji on May 11th. This candle pattern did not come through and the pivot point did not form, so this trade would not have been executed.
United Industrial (Ticker: UIC)
Strategy: Short Sale
Bearish Engulfing pattern on May 11th is the sell signal. Recommendation was to cover the short position on a bounce off of the 200 day moving average and then go long.
As you will see, these trades would have been money makers for you had you followed the Market Guys recommendations. If you are interested in subscribing to The Market Guys Advisory Service just email aj@themarketguys.com
As our newest subscriber you will be able to get these stock picks via special alerts that are in real time so you can profit in the markets just like the rest of our members.

item.description:
Physical fitness vs. Fiscal fitness
Stress will have an affect on how well we make decisions. We will cover some ideas to help you relieve stress, stay fit and feel better about those decisions you make in the marketplace.
Introducing: Gran Moulder
Retired Marine Corp Major, who holds a brown belt in Judo, a 2nd degree black belt in Tai Kwan Do, is a certified fitness trainer through the International Sports Sciences Assn. And is also a personal trainer at Worlds Gym here in Altamonte Springs, Florida. With that Gran is also an active trader in the market who knows what stress can do to you while you are trying to make those decisions to buy and sell
